New Records: Sri Lanka chased down the target of 184 in 19.2 Overs for a two-wicket win
Key Match Events: Sri Lanka won by 2 wickets, chasing down the target of 184 in 19.2 Overs
Taskin Ahmed took 2/24 from four overs
Chamika Karunaratne was run out on 16
Taskin Ahmed took a superb diving catch to dismiss Gunathilaka
Mahedi Hasan overstepped and it resulted in a no ball and Fernando added a quick two
Ebadot Hossain took three wickets in his first two overs
Shakib Al Hasan took a wicket and finished his spell with 1/32
Mustafizur Rahman took 1/32 in four overs
Taskin Ahmed took a superb diving catch to dismiss Mendis
Pre-Game Insights: Sri Lanka and Bangladesh need to win tonight’s clash to ensure a passage to the next stage
Sri Lanka have won the tournament five times before while Bangladesh finished runners-up in 2018
The equation is simple: Win and qualify for the Super Four stage. Lose and pack your bags
Post-Match Reflections: Sri Lanka captain Dasun Shanaka expressed his team's relief after qualifying for the Super Four stage
Sri Lanka’s victory marked their fifth Asia Cup title
Bangladesh team director Khaled Mahmud expressed disappointment after losing to Sri Lanka
Miscellaneous Highlights: Sri Lanka have qualified for the Super Four stage of the Asia Cup 2022
India and Afghanistan have already qualified for the next round
The match was played at the Dubai International Stadium
The match was broadcast on Star Sports Network in India and live-streamed on Disney + Hotstar
Others: Sri Lanka's probable playing XI included Dasun Shanaka, Chamika Karunaratne, Pathum Nissanka, Kusal Mendis, Asalanka, Gunathilaka, Bhanuka Rajapaksa, Wanindu Hasaranga, Maheesh Theekshana, Pathirana, Dilshan Madushanka

Bangladesh's probable playing XI included Mushfiqur Rahim, Mohammad Naim, Anamul Haque, Shakib Al Hasan, Afif Hossain, Mahedi Hasan, Saifuddin, Taskin Ahmed, Mustafizur Rahman, Mahmudullah, Mosaddek Hossain
